title: Catch prediction in Chrome DevTools: Why it's hard and how to make it better
description: Learn how the DevTools debugger predicts whether an exception is caught.

title: Join the Google Chrome Built-in AI Challenge
description: We're launching the Built-in AI Challenge, where we invite you to reimagine what's possible with Gemini Nano in Chrome.

title: How to Download a YouTube Video or Channel
description: The ability to download media on the internet almost feels like a lost art. When I was in my teens, piracy of mp3s, movies, and just about everything else via torrents and apps like Kazaa, LimeWire, Napster, etc. was in full swing. These days sites use blob URLs and other means to prevent downloads. Luckily […] The post How to Download a YouTube Video or Channel appeared first on David Walsh Blog.
author: David Walsh

title: How to Add a Header to a curl Request
description: curl is one of those great utilities that’s been around seemingly forever and has endless use cases. These days I find myself using curl to batch download files and test APIs. Sometimes my testing leads me to using different HTTP headers in my requests. To add a header to a curl request, use the -H […] The post How to Add a Header to a curl Request appeared first on David Walsh Blog.
author: David Walsh

title: Llamafile v0.8.14: a new UI, performance gains, and more
description: Discover the latest release of Llamafile 0.8.14, an open-source AI tool by Mozilla Builders. With a new command-line chat interface, enhanced performance, and support for powerful models, Llamafile makes it easy to run large language models (LLMs) on your own hardware. Learn more about the updates and how to get involved with this cutting-edge project. The post Llamafile v0.8.14: a new UI, performance gains, and more appeared first on Mozilla Hacks - the Web developer blog.
author: Stephen Hood

title: 0Din: A GenAI Bug Bounty Program – Securing Tomorrow’s AI Together
description: As AI continues to evolve, so do the threats against it. As these GenAI systems become more sophisticated and widely adopted, ensuring their security and ethical use becomes paramount. 0Din is a groundbreaking GenAI bug bounty program dedicated specifically to help secure GenAI systems and beyond. In this blog, you'll learn about 0Din, how it works, and how you can participate and make a difference in securing our AI future. The post 0Din: A GenAI Bug Bounty Program – Securing Tomorrow’s AI Together appeared first on Mozilla Hacks - the Web developer blog.
author: Marco Figueroa

title: Solving Background Overflow With Inherited Border Radii
description: One of the interesting (but annoying) things about CSS is the background of children’s elements can bleed out of the border radius of the parent element. Here’s an example of a card with an inner element. If the inner element … Solving Background Overflow With Inherited Border Radii originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
author: Zell Liew

title: Close, Exit, Cancel: How to End User Interactions Well
description: What’s in a word? Actions. In the realm of user interfaces, a word is construed as the telltale of a control’s action. Sometimes it points us in the correct direction, and sometimes it leads us astray.
